t: Then*p Jonah prayed unto the Lord*s his God out of the fish's belly,
And*p said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord,*s and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice.
For*p thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.
Then*p I said, I am cast out of thy sight; yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.
The*p waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.
I*p went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars was about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O Lord*s my God.
When*p my soul fainted within me I remembered the Lord:*s and my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple.
They*p that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
But*p I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of the Lord.*s
And*p the Lord*s spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.
